# Draft:Archaeological Society of Alexandria

The Archaeological Society of Alexandria
History
The Archaeological Society of Alexandria was established in 7 April 1893. At the house of Sir Charles Cookson, the Consul General of Great Britain.
Royal Archaeological Society of Alexandria.
Members
Among its members were important scholars, archaeologists, classicists such as John Pentland Mahaffy. Its members also included Italians, Egyptians, British, French and Greek Alexandrian nobles.
Work
In 1938 the Society supervised the second edition of E. M. Forster’s Alexandria: A History and a Guide.
The Archaeological Society of Alexandria with funds from the A. G. Leventis foundation of Cyprus and permission and supervision of the Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities initiated the Alexandria Necropolis Project (2020-2023) that restored the Hellenistic necropolis at Shatby.
Publications
* ''Bulletin de la Société Royale d'Archéologie d'Alexandrie''
See also
* Graeco-Roman Museum
* Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale
* Egyptian Institute
* Egypt Exploration Society
